senses.de: Having a lot of physical power, able to carry heavy objects or move heavy things.
senses.ex: He is strong enough to lift that heavy box.

Tips.title: Physical Strength
Tips.description: Refers to the ability to exert force or bear weight. Often linked with health and fitness.
Tips.example: Athletes need to be strong to compete.

senses.de: Not easy to break or damage, sturdy, durable.
senses.ex: This table is made of strong wood.

Tips.title: Durability Context
Tips.description: Used for objects that withstand pressure, stress, or wear and tear.
Tips.example: A strong foundation supports a secure house.

senses.de: Very intense or extreme, not mild or weak.
senses.ex: The coffee she made is very strong.

Tips.title: Intensity Aspect
Tips.description: Describes the high degree of a particular quality, like taste or smell.
Tips.example: I prefer a strong flavor in my food.

senses.de: Confident and able to deal with problems.
senses.ex: After her mom passed away, she became the strong one in the family.

Tips.title: Emotional Resilience
Tips.description: Indicates mental or emotional stability, especially under stress or hardship.
Tips.example: He remained strong after the setback.

senses.de: Very good in a particular skill, area or activity.
senses.ex: She has a strong ability in mathematics.

Tips.title: Skill Proficiency
Tips.description: Suggests excellence or high ability in a specific field or action.
Tips.example: Her strong understanding of economics impressed her teachers.

senses.de: Containing a lot of a substance or ingredient.

Tips.title: High Concentration
Tips.description: Indicates an abundance of an ingredient or element, such as alcohol in drinks.
Tips.example: Be careful with the strong chemicals in that cleaner.

Courageous.wordDefinition:
Courageous means being brave or doing something even though it is scary.

It is often used to describe someone who takes risks or faces their fears. For example, a person who stands up for what they believe in, even if it means going against popular opinion or facing criticism, can be described as courageous.

Courageous is applicable when someone is doing something brave or facing their fears, while strong is applicable when someone has physical or mental power or is able to withstand challenges.

Mighty.wordDefinition:
The words mighty and strong both suggest a great amount of power, but there are subtle differences in their meanings.

Mighty implies not just physical strength, but also a sense of authority or greatness.

It is often used to describe heroes or noble figures. For example, Hercules is mighty because of his incredible physical strength, but also because he displays admirable qualities like bravery and selflessness.

Mighty suggests a more grand and awe-inspiring type of power, while strong is more straightforward and focused on physical ability.

Potent.wordDefinition:
Potent refers to something that is powerful and has a strong effect.

For example, a potent pain reliever would be one that is very effective at reducing pain.

Potent refers to something that has a strong effect, while strong refers to something that has a lot of physical or emotional force.

Powerful.wordDefinition:
Powerful refers to the ability to exert great force or influence, while strong refers to the physical or mental capability to withstand stress or pressure.

For example, a person can be physically strong, but not necessarily powerful in terms of influence. A nation or organization can be powerful in terms of their ability to exert influence, but not necessarily physically strong.

Powerful is used more in the context of influence, while strong is used more in the context of physical or mental ability.

Resistant.wordDefinition:
Resistant means to prevent or withstand something from happening. It implies that something can endure and keep working despite adverse circumstances.

For example, a waterproof watch is resistant to water, which means it won't stop working even if it gets wet.

Resistant refers to the ability to withstand something, while strong refers to the ability to bear heavy loads. Each word is applicable in different contexts.

Robust.wordDefinition:
The words robust and strong both mean to be physically or mentally powerful.

However, robust is more applicable to describing something that is resilient and can withstand challenges, while strong is more commonly used to describe physical power or force.

For example, a person may be physically strong, but a tree's roots may be robust enough to endure strong winds.

Sturdy.wordDefinition:
Sturdy means being physically strong and able to withstand rough use or handling. For example, a sturdy pair of shoes can handle a lot of walking without falling apart.

Strong refers to something that can withstand external forces that may cause damage, while sturdy refers to something that is tough and durable, able to handle wear and tear over time.

Tough.wordDefinition: The term tough refers to something that is durable or able to withstand physical stress, such as a tough fabric or a tough piece of meat.

Vigorous.wordDefinition:
Vigorous refers to something that is done with great energy and enthusiasm, showing strong or assertive movement.

For example, a vigorous workout or a vigorous debate.

Strong describes a person or thing that has power, while vigorous describes action that is done with energy and enthusiasm.

quotes.Text: I just want fans to walk away knowing that no matter what's going on, no matter how happy you are, no matter how sad you are, we did it. We're strong in this. We've come a long way, and life is not just one thing.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Mary J. Blige

quotes.Text: We are braver and wiser because they existed, those strong women and strong men... We are who we are because they were who they were. It's wise to know where you come from, who called your name.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Maya Angelou

quotes.Text: The beauty of love, as far as I'm concerned, is it makes you better. It makes you stronger. It gives you direction. It gives you understanding of what life is and what we've been given.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Jerry Lewis

quotes.Text: Strong managers who make tough decisions to cut jobs provide the only true job security in today's world. Weak managers are the problem. Weak managers destroy jobs.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jack Welch

quotes.Text: The war made me stronger; it was a very hard time for me and my family. I don't want to drag that with me forever, but I don't want to forget about it, either.
quotes.Title: Croatian Athlete
quotes.Name: Luka Modric

quotes.Text: I never won anything by myself. I was always strong because of help that gave me extra strength to win.
quotes.Title: American Wrestler
quotes.Name: Dan Gable

quotes.Text: There is one thing stronger than all the armies in the world, and that is an idea whose time as come.
quotes.Title: French Author
quotes.Name: Victor Hugo

quotes.Text: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.Text: I was raised by strong women, and that DNA is in my daughter and wife.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Dwayne Johnson

quotes.Text: You are never strong enough that you don't need help.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Cesar Chavez
